ARABIC: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Truly We fear from our Lord a glowering, calamitous Day.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We fear the dismal day calamitous from our Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: we fear from our Lord a Day that shall be long and distressful.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We are afraid of our Lord and the bitterly distressful day".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Indeed we fear from our Lord a day which is extremely bitter, most severe.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We fear from our Lord a Day that is `Abus and Qamtarir."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely we fear from our Lord a stern, distressful day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: for we fear from our Lord a frowning day, inauspicious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! we fear from our Lord a day of frowning and of fate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Truly, we fear from our Lord a woefully grim Day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily we dread from our Lord a Day grim and distressful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed we fear a frowning and fateful day from our Lord.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We only fear a Day of distressful Wrath from the side of our Lord."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We fear from our Lord a Day, hard and distressful, that will make the faces look horrible (from extreme dislikeness to it)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: for we fear from our Lord a stern, frownful Day'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We dread from our Lord a frowning grim Day.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:10] Indeed we fear from our Lord a day of frowning, one in which faces scowl, in other words, a horrid day to observe on account of its severity, calamitous’, severe in that respect.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! we fear from our Lord) from the punishment of our Lord (a day of frowning) when faces are frowning (and of fate) a hard day whose torment and horrors are severe.
